name: regear
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to change something, especially to make it suitable for a new situation: She has been advised to re-gear her campaign. Fishers have been given the opportunity to restructure their fishing operations, perhaps by regearing to catch fish by the less harmful method of line fishing.
More examplesFewer examplesWe really need to regear our thinking.The Internet bubble permanently regeared the economy.We decided that we should regear our operations internationally.
